docs.snippet: Camille Cosby, Bill Cosby’s wife of nearly 51 years, has spoken out for decades against images of African-Americans as seen on television and in other media....
docs.lead_paragraph: Camille Cosby, Bill Cosby’s wife of nearly 51 years, has spoken out for decades against images of African-Americans as seen on television and in other media.
docs.abstract: Camille O Cosby has been staunchest supporter of her husband Bill Cosby in face of accusations of sexual abuse by multiple women; frames her defense of him in terms of media's unfair representation of African-Americans, subject she has been vocal about for many years.

headline.main: Well Before Scandals, Cosby’s Wife Faulted Media Treatment of Blacks
headline.print_headline: Well Before Scandals, Cosby’s Wife Faulted Media Treatment of Blacks

byline.contributor: Susan Beachy. Elisa Cho and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By SERGE F. KOVALESKI and COLIN MOYNIHAN

docs.snippet: Kenya Barris, creator of ABC's "black-ish," was motivated to write the comedy about an African-American family's efforts to honor its heritage in part by the unreality of what he grew up watching on television....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kenya Barris, creator of ABC's "black-ish," was motivated to write the comedy about an African-American family's efforts to honor its heritage in part by the unreality of what he grew up watching on television.

headline.main: TV Networks Make Unequal Progress Toward On-Screen Diversity
